question: The blue green alga Anabaena lives in the leaves of Azolla, a freshwater fern, forming which of the following relationships ? SSC MTS 12/09/2023 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Symbiotic relationships are the close associations formed between pairs of species. question: Identify a structure that plays a role in motility. SSC Stenographer 11/12/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Flagella are long, whip-like structures that protrude from the cell surface of certain bacteria and eukaryotic cells. The other options are not directly involved in motility: Pili are short, hair-like structures involved in bacterial attachment and DNA transfer. Villi are finger-like projections found in the small intestine, involved in nutrient absorption. Fimbria are short, hair-like structures involved in bacterial attachment and adhesion.

question: In the case of reptiles, their heart is not properly divided into four chambers i.e., it consists of two auricles and an incompletely divided ventricle. Which of the following is an example of a reptile having a four-chambered heart? SSC MTS 07/10/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Crocodile. Reptiles are terrestrial animals known for their creeping or crawling mode of locomotion, characterized by dry, cornified skin or scales. They typically have a three-chambered heart, though crocodiles possess a four-chambered heart. Reptiles are poikilothermic, meaning they rely on external temperatures to regulate body heat. They have internal fertilization, are oviparous, and undergo direct development. Examples include turtles, lizards, crocodiles , and venomous snakes like cobras and vipers.

question: Which of the following is an example of Phylum Arthropoda? SSC CGL 19/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Butterfly. Phylum Arthropoda is the largest phylum in the animal kingdom, first classified by Von Seibold in 1845. Approximately two-thirds of all named species belong to this phylum. Arthropods have a chitinous exoskeleton, jointed appendages, and various respiratory organs, including gills, book gills, book lungs, or a tracheal system. They possess an open circulatory system, and excretion occurs through Malpighian tubules. Examples include cockroaches, prawns, crabs, scorpions, houseflies, and mites.

question: Which of the following is a characteristic of both mammals and birds? SSC CGL 26/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Warm blooded. Warm-blooded animals can maintain a constant body temperature regardless of environmental conditions by regulating their metabolic processes. Instead, they depend on their environment to regulate their temperature. Examples of cold-blooded animals include fish, amphibians, reptiles, insects, worms, crocodiles, sharks, and tortoises.

question: Match the points under Column A with those under Column B. Column A Column B (Subphylum) (Animal) i. Hexapoda a. Daphnia ii. Crustacea b. Mosquito iii. Myriapoda c. Limulus iv. Chelicerata d. Julus SSC CGL 26/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

question: Which of the following statements most accurately describes the Cyclostomata group ? SSC CHSL 11/07/2024 (1st shift)

question: The body of the phylum _______ is unsegmented and dorsoventrally flattened. SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: Platyhelminthes: They are known as flatworms due to their dorsoventrally flattened bodies. Examples include Taenia (tapeworm) and Fasciola (liver fluke). Coelenterata - Generally known as Cnidaria. Examples: Pleurobrachia; Ctenoplana. Arthropoda - The largest phylum of Animalia, and includes insects (More than two-thirds of all species on earth). Examples: Apis (Honey bee); Bombyx (Silkworm). Mollusca - Second largest animal phylum. Body covered with a calcareous shell. Example: Pila (Apple snail); Pinctada (Pearl oyster).

question: Identify the organism that shows bioluminescence. SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Ctenoplana commonly known as sea walnuts or comb jellies are exclusively marine, radially symmetrical, diploblastic organisms with tissue level of organisation. The body bears eight external rows of ciliated comb plates, which help in locomotion. Sexes are not separate. Bioluminescence (the property of a living organism to emit light) is well-marked in ctenophores. Examples: Pleurobrachia and Ctenoplana.

question: Biotic potential can be defined as: Matriculation Level 25/06/2024 (Shift - 1)

options.A: the minimum number of individuals of
options.B: the maximum number of individuals a
options.C: the minimum number of individuals a

solution.correct_answer: B. the maximum number of individuals a
solution.explanation: Biotic potential, also known as reproductive potential, refers to the maximum rate at which a population of a species can increase under ideal conditions, with unlimited resources and no environmental limitations. Biotic potential differs from one species to another e.g., bacterial populations can grow faster than populations of oak trees.

question: ____ is an example of acoelomate. Higher Secondary 24/06/2024 (Shift - 2)

solution.explanation: Platyhelminthes. They have a dorso-ventrally flattened body, hence are called flatworms. Examples: Taenia (Tapeworm), Fasciola (Liver fluke). The animals in which the body cavity is absent are called acoelomates. Echinoderms comprise a group of marine invertebrates that includes sea stars, sea urchins, sea cucumbers, brittle stars, and crinoids.

question: In which of the following animals are the stinging capsules located around the mouth and on the tentacles? Graduate Level 26/06/2024 (Shift - 4)

solution.explanation: Adamsia. Stinging capsules (nematocysts) are the organs which act as offense and defense. These nematocysts help Sea Anemones: Capture prey, Defend against predators, Compete for space. They belong to phylum Coelenterata. Other animals with stinging capsules include: Jellyfish, Corals, Hydra, Portuguese Man-of-War.

question: Which of the following is NOT a member of the Arthropoda phylum? SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Pila - It belongs to the phylum Mollusca and class Gastropoda.

question: Which of the following choices is related to the phylum Coelenterata ? SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Aurelia. Coelenterata (Cnidaria) : They are aquatic, mostly marine, sessile or free-swimming, radially symmetrical animals. Phylum (Porifera) : Members of this phylum are commonly known as sponges. They are generally marine and mostly asymmetrical animals. These are primitive multicellular animals and have cellular level of organisation. Examples : Sycon (Scypha), Spongilla (Freshwater sponge) and Euspongia (Bath sponge).

question: Which of the following is NOT a Protozoan? SSC Stenographer 13/10/2023 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Scypha (Kingdom: Animalia). Protozoans (Kingdom: Protista) - All protozoans are heterotrophs and live as parasites. Major groups of protozoans : Amoeboid protozoans - These organisms live in freshwater, sea water or moist soil. Flagellated protozoans - The members of this group are either free-living or parasitic. Ciliated protozoans - These are aquatic, actively moving organisms because of the presence of thousands of cilia. Sporozoans - This includes diverse organisms that have an infectious spore-like stage in their life cycle.

question: Identify the third germinal layer found in triploblastic animals. SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Mesoderm. A triploblastic animal has three main layers of tissue during embryonic development. Ectoderm (upper layer) - It forms the brains, spinal cord, lens of the eye and hairs. Mesoderm (Middle layer) - It is responsible for the formation of notochord, bone, muscles, connective tissue and circulatory systems. Endoderm (lower layer) - It leads to the formation of the stomach, liver, colon, urinary bladder and lungs.

question: Which of the following is a roundworm ? SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Ascaris - It belongs to phylum Nematoda. It is known as the small-intestinal roundworms, a type of

question: Which of the following organisms belongs to phylum Apicomplexa? SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Plasmodium. Apicomplexa is a large phylum of parasitic protists belonging to the Alveolata group, together with ciliates and dinoflagellates. The Apicomplexa are a diverse group that includes organisms such as the coccidia, gregarines, piroplasms, haemogregarines, and plasmodia. Diseases caused by Apicomplexa : Babesiosis (Babesia), and Malaria (Plasmodium).

question: What is Typhlops? SSC CGL 18/07/2023 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Blind snake. Phylum - Chordata, Family - Typhlopidae. Typhlops is a genus of blind snakes (nonpoisonous snakes). Some other types of snakes - Sea snake : Family - Elapidae, Genus - Hydrophis. Grass snake : Family - Colubridae, Genus - Natrix. Glass snake : Family - Anguidae, Genus - Ophisaurus.

question: Match the animals in column A with the phylum they belong to in column B. Column-A Column-B i. Jellyfish a. Mollusca ii. Crayfish b. Mammal iii. Whale fish c. Insect iv. Devil fish d. Coelenterat SSC CGL 19/07/2023 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: i-d, ii-c, iii-b, iv-a.

question: Which from the following is a phylum of animals found in fresh water ponds, lakes and swamps provides setae or parapodia for locomotion? SSC CGL 19/07/2023 (4th shift)

solution.explanation: Annelida. Some other members of this phylum: Oligochaeta (earthworms) and class Hirudinea (leeches), polychaete worms.

question: Identify an organism that has a well-defined muscular pharynx. SSC CGL 20/07/2023 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Ascaris. Adamsia - It is a species of sea anemone in the family Hormathiidae. It is commonly known as the cloak anemone or the hermit-crab anemone. Ctenoplana - It is the genus of comb jellies and the only genus in the Ctenoplanidae family. Gorgonia - It is a genus of soft corals, sea fans in the family Gorgoniidae.

question: Which type of liverworts form umbrella-shaped structures that raise gametangia above the main gametophyte body and sporophytes develop below these structures ? SSC CGL 20/07/2023 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Marchantia (Genus of liverworts). Polytrichum (Genus of mosses) - These mosses are commonly known as haircap mosses found in forest and humid environments. Sphagnum : A genus of mosses known as "peat mosses" found in wetlands and peat bogs. Funaria - It is a genus of mosses commonly known as cord mosses. They have tall, slender stalks that bear capsules at their tips.

question: Meandrina is the generic name of which Coelenterata animal having soft tube-shaped bodies that live together in large groups? SSC CGL 20/07/2023 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Brain coral. Coelenterata (Phylum) : It is a multicellular and simplest group of invertebrate animals.

question: Identify the animal that does NOT have bilateral symmetry. SSC CGL 21/07/2023 (4th shift)

solution.explanation: Cnidarian. Bilateral symmetry - When the body plan of an animal can be divided along a line that separates the animal's body into right and left halves that are nearly identical to each other. Examples - Flatworms, Common worms (ribbon worms), Clams, Snails, Insects, Spiders, Sea urchins, and Vertebrates.

question: Which group of Kingdom Animalia has unsegmented, bilaterally symmetrical, soft bodies, with a triploblastic construction (comprising three layers of cells) and a lacking coelom, skeleton and anus? SSC CGL 24/07/2023( 3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Platyhelminthes (Tapeworms, Turbellaria, Planaria, Liver fluke). Bilateral symmetry means when one organism is cut, it divides into two equal halves from a single plane only.

question: In which of the following animal phyla, is the body divided into head, thorax and abdomen? SSC CGL 26/07/2023 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Arthropoda (largest phylum). The phylum included invertebrates with an exoskeleton and jointed legs; Examples - Spiders, centipedes, mites, crabs, ticks, lobsters, scorpions, shrimp. Chordata - Fundamentally characterized by the presence of a notochord, a dorsal, hollow nerve cord and paired pharyngeal gill slits; Examples -Lampreys, Sea Squirt.

question: Identify an algae that undergoes anisogamous fusion of gametes. Matric Level 28/06/2023 (Shift - 1)

solution.explanation: Eudorina. Anisogamy (Heterogamy) - A type of sexual reproduction in which two dissimilar gametes unite or fuse. Isogamy - The gametes are similar in shape and size. They are shown differences only in their physiology. They are rounded in shape, and flagella are present at the end of the front. It is the first stage of sexual reproduction, and found in algae, fungi, and lower plants. Oogamous - The female gamete is much bigger than the male. The female gamete is immobile, while the male gamete is mobile.

question: The _____ is an embryonic midline structure common to all members of the phylum Chordata that serves as a source of midline signals to surrounding tissues and as a major skeletal element of the developing embryo. Matric Level 28/06/2023 (Shift - 4)

solution.explanation: Notochord. Nerve cord - It is a vast bundle of nerve fibres that runs along the body's longitudinal axis and an essential component of the Central

question: Balanoglossus belongs to which of the following phylums of the animal kingdom? SSC MTS 04/05/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Hemichordata. Types of phylum of Animal Kingdom : Porifera {(Examples : Sycon (Scypha), Spongilla (Freshwater sponge) and Euspongia (Bath sponge)}. Coelenterata (Examples - Aurelia (Medusa), Adamsia (Polyp)}. Ctenophora (Examples - Pleurobrachia and Ctenoplana). Platyhelminthes {Examples - Taenia (Tapeworm), Fasciola (Liver fluke)}. Aschelminthes (Example - Roundworm). Annelida {Examples - Nereis, Hirudinaria}.

question: Which among the following is an example of Phylum Mammalia of Animal Kingdom? SSC MTS 16/05/2023 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Rat. Mammals are warm - blooded animals that have mammary glands and give birth to live young. Fishes, amphibians and reptiles are poikilothermous (cold-blooded).

question: Snails is an example of which of the phylum of the animal kingdom? SSC MTS 20/06/2023 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Mollusca (Second-largest invertebrate animal phylum). Snails are invertebrates, belonging to the Eukaryota domain and Animalia kingdom. Protochordates - Group of primitive chordates that include tunicates, lancelets, and the extinct Pikaia.

question: Which among the following pairs of ‘animal - phylum of animal kingdom they belong’ is incorrect? SSC CHSL 13/03/2023 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Liver fluke - Nematoda. Phylum : Porifera - Spongilla, Sycon. Platyhelminthes - Tapeworm, Planaria. Nematoda - Ascaris, Wuchereria. Annelida - Earthworm, Leech. Arthropoda - Spiders, butterflies, Prawns and mosquitoes. Mollusca - Snails and octopus. Echinodermata - Sea urchins, starfish. Coelenterata - Hydra, Jellyfish.

question: Hydra is an example of which of the following phylum of the animal kingdom? SSC CHSL 20/03/2023 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Coelenterata. It is a group of aquatic, or marine organisms and usually found attached to the rocks at the bottom of the sea.

question: Which of the following comes under the platyhelminthes classification under the animalia? SSC CHSL 20/03/2023 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Tapeworm. Platyhelminthes - belongs to Kingdom Animalia also known as Tapeworm or Flatworms (due to flattened Body), soft - bodied invertebrate, Hermaphrodites, triploblastic, acoelomate and bilaterally symmetrical. Classified into 3 types - Turbellaria (Planaria, Otoplana), Trematoda (Fasciola hepatica, Diplozoon), Cestoda (Taenia, Convoluta).

question: Which group of animals are named because of their spiny skin and have a peculiar water-driven tube system that they use for moving around? SSC CGL Tier II (03/03/2023)

solution.explanation: Echinodermata. Aschelminthes (roundworms) : They are a diverse phylum of unsegmented, bilaterally symmetrical worms with cylindrical bodies.

question: Identify an example of organisms that are free-swimming and bottom - dwelling forms. SSC CGL 01/12/2022 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Zooplankton are a type of heterotrophic plankton that range from microscopic organisms to large species, such as jellyfish, larval crustaceans, krill, copepods, protozoans, etc. They are the primary consumers in lake ecosystems.

question: Identify the organism that is NOT a pseudocoelomate. SSC CGL 02/12/2022 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Scorpions {Kingdom (Animalia), Phylum (Arthropoda), Subphylum (Chelicerata), Class (Arachnida)}. Pseudocoelomates are the organisms that have false body cavities. The pseudocoelomates belong to the phylum Nematoda/Aschelminthes. Examples: Aschleminthes - Nematoda (Ancylostoma, Ascaris, Wuchereria), Rotifera (Asplanchna, Euchlanis, etc) .

question: Identify an example of decomposers that are found in the bottom of a pond. SSC CGL 02/12/2022 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: Flagellates. The decomposers of the pond ecosystem are fungi, bacteria and flagellates. Decomposers in different ecosystems: Soil (fungi, insects, earthworms, and bacteria), Oceans (Christmas tree worm, Crab, Granulated sea star, Hagfish, Sea urchin, Tube worm), Freshwater (Mildew, Trumpet snail, Water mold, Yeast), Forest (Beetle, Earthworm, Millipede, Mushroom, Pillbug, Saprobe, Slime mold, Slug), Desert (Dung beetle, Fly, Millipede, Saharan silver ant), Grassland (Acidobacteria, Termite, Turkey tail mushroom), Mountain (Bolete mushroom, Mountain pine bark beetle, Purple fairy fingers).

question: The body of the ______ is circular in cross-section, hence the name roundworms. They may be free living, aquatic and terrestrial or parasitic in plants and animals. SSC CGL 03/12/2022 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: Aschelminthes (roundworms) - An obsolete phylum of wormlike invertebrates, mostly of microscopic size. Body is elongated and cylindrical. Appear circular in cross-section.

question: Which of the following cells line the spongocoels and canals in members of the phylum Porifera? SSC CGL 09/12/2022 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Collar cells (Choanocytes, flagellated cells) line the inner surface of the spongocoel and the canal of sponges. The beating of the flagella from all choanocytes draws water into the sponge through the numerous Ostia, into the spaces lined by choanocytes, and eventually out through the osculum. The term somatic cells refer to any type of

question: Which of the following is NOT a polar animal? SSC MTS 11/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Lemurs are a type of prosimian, which means they are primates that evolved before monkeys and apes. Polar Animals : Polar Bear, Arctic Fox, Antarctic Minke Whale, Brown Bear, Pacific Salmon, Orca, Snowy Owl, Leopard Seal, Arctic Wolf,Penguin, Walrus, Narwhal, Arctic Hare, Beluga Whale, Puffin, Reindeer, Musk Oxen.

question: Which of the following statements is/are correct? I. Amoeba ingests its food with the help of pseudopodia. II. Amoeba constantly changes its shape and position. SSC MTS 11/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Only I. Amoeba is a unicellular organism that has the ability to change its shape. Amoeba reproduces asexually through binary fission. Examples : Entamoeba Histolytica, Amoeba Proteus, Chaos carolinense etc.

question: Which of the following is not a characteristic of Kingdom Fungi? SSC MTS 25/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: With chloroplasts. Fungi are eukaryotic organisms that include microorganisms such as yeasts, moulds and mushrooms. Characteristics of Fungi : They are non-vascular, non-motile and heterotrophic organisms, They may be unicellular or filamentous, They reproduce by means of spores, They exhibit the phenomenon of alternation of generation, They lack chlorophyll and hence cannot perform photosynthesis, They store their food in the form of starch, Biosynthesis of chitin occurs in them, The nuclei of the these are very small, etc.

question: ________is commonly known as imperfect fungi because only the asexual or vegetative phases of these fungi are known. SSC MTS 26/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Deuteromycetes, commonly called molds, are “second-class” fungi that have no known sexual state in their life cycle and thus reproduce only by producing spores via mitosis. This asexual state is also called the anamorph state. Phycomycetes organisms are found throughout the world in soil, animal manure, and on fruits. Basidiomycetes are commonly known as club fungi. Ascomycetes are spore shooters, they are called sac fungi because their sexual spores, called ascospores, are produced in a sac or ascus.

question: Which of the following is a group of primitive vertebrates having a large jawless sucking mouth, no limbs or paired fins and a completely cartilaginous skeleton with a persistent notochord? SSC CHSL 26/05/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Cyclostomata - Hagfishes and lampreys. Aschelminthes - Roundworm - Ascaris lumbricoides, Hookworm - Ancylostoma, Filarial worm - Wuchereria.

question: Which group of animals has a body wall composed of both circular and longitudinal muscle fibres surrounded by a moist, cellular cuticle that is secreted by an epidermal epithelium? SSC CHSL 27/05/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Annelids are coelomate and triploblastic. Their body is segmented. They respire through their body surface. Examples - Earthworm, Leeches, Lugworms, Polychaetes etc.

question: The bodies of the animals of phylum Platyhelminthes show _____grade organisation. SSC CHSL 02/06/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Tissue-organ. Protoplasmic is a mixture of water, amino acids, proteins, small molecules of ions, macromolecules such as nucleic acids, etc. Cellular respiration is a metabolic pathway that breaks down glucose and produces ATP. Adenosine triphosphate (ATP) is the source of energy for use and storage at the cellular level.

question: Which of the following characters are correct about Phylum Echinodermata ? SSC CHSL 03/06/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Coelom present, bilateral symmetry. Phylum Echinodermata organisms (multi-cellular) are exclusively marine. Characteristics - Triploblastic and have a coelomic cavity, star-like appearance and are spherical or elongated, respire through gills, their skeleton is made up of calcium carbonate. Examples - a starfish, a sand dollar, a brittle star, a sea urchin, and a sea cucumber.

question: The body of animals of the phylum Protozoa, such as Paramecium, Amoeba, Euglena, shows ________ grade organisation. SSC CHSL 10/06/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Protoplasmic. It is a mixture of water, amino acids, proteins, small molecules of ions, macromolecules such as nucleic acids, etc.

question: Which of the following statements is correct with respect to chordates? SSC CGL 11/04/2022(Afternoon)

options.B: Heart is dorsal or laterally placed or
options.C: A post anal tail is absent

solution.correct_answer: B. Heart is dorsal or laterally placed or
solution.explanation: The five characteristic features of chordates present during some time of their life cycles are a notochord, a dorsal hollow tubular nerve cord, pharyngeal slits, endostyle/thyroid gland, and a post-anal tail. Examples of vertebrate chordates include fishes, amphibians, reptiles, birds, and mammals.

solution.explanation: Red seaweeds. "Seaweed" is the common name for countless species of marine plants and algae that grow in

question: How many eyes does a bee have? SSC CGL 21/04/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Five. The honey bee has five eyes, two large compound eyes and three smaller ocelli eyes in the centre of its head. Micro Organism

question: Which of the following is considered unicellular green algae ? SSC MTS 16/10/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Chlamydomonas. Unicellular green algae are single-celled, plant-like organisms containing chlorophyll. Chlamydomonas, with two flagella, thrives in water and soil, often turning water green. Chlorella is protein-rich and used as a food supplement. Volvox forms spherical colonies, showcasing unique colonial behavior.

question: Which of the following organisms is used in bread and alcohol industries? SSC MTS 22/10/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Yeast, particularly Saccharomyces cerevisiae, is widely used in the bread and alcohol industries for fermentation, helping to produce carbon dioxide for leavening bread and ethanol for alcoholic beverages. Clostridium is a genus of anaerobic, Gram-positive bacteria. Nitrobacter is a genus comprising rod-shaped, gram-negative, and chemoautotrophic bacteria. Penicillium is a genus of ascomycetous fungi.

question: Which of the following categories does Gonyaulax belong to? SSC CGL 11/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Dinoflagellates. These organisms are mainly marine, photosynthetic organisms that can appear in various colors such as yellow, green, brown, blue, or red, depending on their pigments. Euglenoids include Euglena, Chrysophytes encompass diatoms and golden algae, while Amoeba represents protozoans.

question: Microbes like Rhizobium, Nitrosomonas and Nitrobacter are used for: SSC CGL 12/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: nitrogen cycling. Nitrogen cycle is the biogeochemical cycle that describes the transformation of nitrogen and nitrogen-containing compounds in nature. Atmospheric nitrogen is the biggest source of nitrogen. Green plants absorb nitrogen in the form of nitrates and nitrites from the soil and water. Animals get nitrogen when they feed upon plants.

question: The organisms that do not have a defined nucleus or organelles are classified into _______ Kingdom. SSC CGL 12/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Monera - It comprises unicellular, prokaryotic organisms, having no well-defined nucleus and no organelles. Bacteria are the sole members of the Kingdom Monera. Kingdom Monera is classified into three sub-kingdoms- Archaebacteria, Eubacteria, and Cyanobacteria. Protista - The protistan cell body contains a well defined nucleus and other membrane-bound organelles. Plantae - It includes all eukaryotic chlorophyll -containing organisms commonly called plants. Fungi - They are eukaryotic organisms that include microorganisms such as yeasts, moulds and mushrooms.

question: Which of the following options indicates the size of PPLO (Pleuro Pneumonia Like Organisms)? SSC CGL 17/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: About 0.1 μm. Pleuropneumonia-like organisms (PPLO), or mycoplasmas, are among the smallest bacteria, ranging from 0.1 to 0.3 mm.

question: Identify a spiral-shaped bacteria SSC CGL 18/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Spirillum - A bacterium with rigid spiral (helical) structure (not easily band, not flexible), thick, long, and move with flagella, 6–15 μm long and spiral in shape. For example, Campylobacter jejuni and Helicobacter pylori. Bacteria are grouped into four categories based on their shape - Coccus: Spherical in shape, Bacillus: Rod-shaped, and Vibrio: Comma-shaped.

question: Which bacteria have a thick cell wall with several layers of peptidoglycan and teichoic acid ? SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Staphylococcus aureus is a gram - positive spherically shaped bacterium, a member of the Bacillota, and is a usual member of the microbiota of the body, frequently found in the upper respiratory tract and on the skin.

question: Which of the following bacteria grow in milk and convert it to curd ? Higher Secondary 20/06/2024 (Shift - 2)

solution.explanation: Lactic acid bacteria. This group of bacteria, which includes species like Lactobacillus, is responsible for fermenting lactose in milk to produce lactic acid, thereby converting milk into curd. Salmonella typhi - causes typhoid fever.

question: Select the INCORRECT statement about Agar. Graduate Level 21/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

options.A: Agar is used to grow microbes.
options.B: Agar, one of the commercial products
options.C: It is used as a nutrient and source of
options.D: It is used in preparations of

solution.correct_answer: C. It is used as a nutrient and source of
solution.explanation: Agar is not a source of fat for bacterial culture, but it is used as a solid growth surface to help feed and grow bacteria. Agar is a gelatinous heteropolysaccharide produced in the cell wall of marine red algae such as species of Gelidium, Gracilaria, Gigartina, etc.

question: How many components do bacterial flagella have ? SSC Stenographer 13/10/2023 (Evening)

solution.explanation: 3. The bacterial flagellum is a

question: What is the diameter size range of the virus? SSC Stenographer 13/10/2023 (Evening)

solution.explanation: 20-200 nm. Virus - It is much smaller than bacteria and most of it is microscopic. Viral diseases - Chickenpox, Measles, Rubella, Roseola, Polio.

question: Which of the following can degrade detritus into simpler inorganic substances? SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Fungal enzymes. The process of breaking down complex organic matter in the detritus to simple organic or inorganic compounds is called Catabolism. Bacterial and fungal enzymes can degrade detritus into simpler inorganic substances. DNA polymerase is a catabolic enzyme which catalyses DNA synthesis.

question: Which of the following is a kind of Xanthan? SSC CHSL 14/08/2023 (4th shift)

solution.explanation: Microbial gum. Xanthan gum : A microbial exo-polysaccharide produced by Xanthomonas bacteria. It is an effective thickening agent, emulsifier, and stabiliser that prevents ingredients from separating. Xanthan gum is produced by the fermentation of glucose and sucrose. Xanthan gum discovered by Allene Jeanes.

question: Which of the following pairs of microorganism - type is correct? I. Paramecium - Fungi II. Penicillium - Protozoa SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Neither I nor II. Microorganisms types : Algae (photosynthetic eukaryotic organisms, embryophytes and green algae), Protozoa (Paramecia, Amoeba, Euglena), Slime moulds (Stemonitis, Physarum, Dictyostellida, Lycogala, Tubifera, etc.), Fungi (yeasts, penicillium, rusts, smuts, mildews, molds), Bacteria (Escherichia coli, Spirillum volutans), Archaea (hyperthermophiles, methanogens), Viruses (Influenza, HIV, Pneumon).

question: Which aquatic microorganisms eat phytoplankton and then become food for fish, crustaceans and other large species? SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Zooplankton (eat phytoplankton and become food for other organisms) are small, free-floating aquatic microorganisms including rotifers, jellyfish, and open-water insect larvae.

question: What kind of adaptation is seen in bacteria when they form various kinds of thick- walled spores. SSC CHSL 01/06/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Suspend. Endospores are thick-walled structures formed in bacteria in order to survive unfavorable conditions such as extreme boiling and freezing temperatures and ultraviolet radiations. They protect and allow the bacteria to exist in “suspended animation”. They also formed lower plants like bryophytes, lichens, algae, and Fungi.

question: Which unicellular organism acquires food by a process in which cells absorb external material by engulfing it with the cell membrane? SSC CHSL 02/06/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Amoeba is a unicellular organism that has the ability to change its shape. They are omnipresent and found in water bodies. Yeast (unicellular) converts sugar and starch into carbon dioxide and alcohol. It reproduces by budding.

question: Which is the toxin-causing bacterium that spoils cream, cheese and milk and makes them taste bitter, sour or bitter? SSC CHSL 07/06/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Bacillus cereus is a Gram - positive, rod-shaped, anaerobic, motile, beta-hemolytic, spore-forming bacterium commonly found in soil, food, and marine sponges. It can cause two types of gastrointestinal illness : emetic (vomiting) syndrome and diarrhoeal syndrome.

question: What is a biotechnological process accomplished by yeast, some type of bacteria, or some other microorganism to convert sugar into ethyl alcohol and carbon dioxide? SSC CHSL 07/06/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Alcoholic fermentation. Alcoholic beverages like beer, wine, brandy, whisky, etc are made using fermentation of grains, grapes, rice, etc by yeast. Pasteurization (heat-treatment process) destroys pathogenic microorganisms in certain foods and beverages. Glycolysis is the process in which glucose is broken down to produce energy.

question: Identify the algae that is NOT a marine algae. SSC CHSL 07/06/2022 (Evening)

solution.correct_answer: C. When doses are taken higher than
solution.explanation: Pharmaceutical drug (medication or medicine) - A chemical substance used to treat, prevent, or diagnose a disease or to promote well-being.

question: Why do pickles last longer? SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (Evening)

options.A: The water content of the pickle
options.C: Pickle is prepared in a vacuum so that
options.D: Only beneficial bacteria can grow in

solution.correct_answer: B. Bacterial and fungal cells get
solution.explanation: Plasmolysis is the process by which a plant cell loses water when placed in a hypertonic solution. Examples of Plasmolysis are : Shrinkage of vegetables in hypertonic conditions, Blood cells shrink when they are placed in hypertonic conditions.

question: At what temperature (in degree celsius) is milk heated for 15 to 30 seconds to kill microbes in the pasteurisation method? SSC CHSL 07/08/2023 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: 70℃. Pasteurisation : Process by which milk is heated to a specific temperature for a set period of time to kill harmful bacteria that can lead to diseases like Listeriosis, Typhoid fever, Tuberculosis, Diphtheria and Brucellosis. This process was discovered by Louis Pasteur.

question: Which plant is considered a noxious weed that has a chemical defence mechanism to protect it from predators? SSC CGL 19/07/2023 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Calotropis. It produces a compound called cardiac glycosides as a defence mechanism. Other plants with chemical defences : Poison Ivy (Toxicodendron radicans) - Contains urushiol, Poppies (Papaver) - Produce alkaloids such as morphine and codeine, Tobacco (Nicotiana) - Contains nicotine.

question: Which of the soluble fibres found in fruits is used as a thickener in cooking and baking? SSC CGL 24/07/2023 (4th shift)

solution.explanation: Pectin. Food Thickener - A thickening agent that increases the viscosity of a liquid mix without interfering with its other properties. Other food thickening agents : Corn Starch, Xanthan gum, Gelatin, Potato Starch, Arrowroot and Agar-agar. Inulin - A type of prebiotic, a compound that encourages the healthy growth of gut bacteria.

question: Which of the following is a tertiary consumer? SSC MTS 19/05/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Snake. Trophic levels in the food chain : Producers/autotrophs (first trophic level), consumers (second, third, and fourth trophic levels), and decomposers. Producers : Plants (Grass), phytoplankton, and plant-like organisms (algae). Primary Consumers : Herbivores (grasshopper, rabbit, horse, giraffe, human, deer, turtle). Secondary consumers : Dogs, Frog, Wolves. Tertiary Consumer : Lions, Tigers, Crocodiles, Polar bears, Jaguars. Decomposers: Bacteria, fungi.

question: _____ percent can be taken as the average value for the amount of organic matter that is present at each step of the food chain and reaches the next level of consumers. SSC CHSL 16/03/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: 10. The 10% rule was introduced by Raymond Lindeman in 1942. According to this rule, only about ten percent of the biological food energy is stored in the organism's body when transferred from one trophic level to the next, while the remaining energy is lost in various activities and as heat. The remaining 90 % is lost during transfer, broken down in respiration, or lost to incomplete digestion by higher trophic level.

question: What do you call the type of drugs that mimic the natural messenger by switching on the receptor? SSC CGL Tier II (02/03/2023)

solution.explanation: Agonist. Stimulants are a class of drugs that speed up messages travelling between the brain and body. Examples - Caffeine, nicotine, amphetamines, cocaine, etc.

question: What do you call the drugs that bind to the receptor site and inhibit its natural function? SSC CGL Tier II (07/03/2023)

solution.explanation: Antagonists.Antidepressants are medications that help alleviate symptoms of depression and improve mood. Examples - Agomelatine, amitriptyline, citalopram, clomipramine, etc. Depressants are a type of drug that slows down brain activity, which causes the muscles to relax and calms and soothes a person. Examples - Diazepam, clonazepam, alprazolam, etc.

question: Nutritional care during illness is an organised group of activities which consists of all of the following, EXCEPT: SSC CGL Tier II (07/03/2023)

solution.explanation: Assessing psychological stress. The Nutrition Care Process (NCP) is a systematic approach to providing high quality nutrition care. The NCP consists of four distinct, interrelated steps : Nutrition Assessment, Nutrition Diagnosis, Nutrition Intervention, Nutrition Monitoring/Evaluation.

question: Husk of a coconut is made of ______ tissue. SSC CGL 03/12/2022 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Sclerenchyma tissue (provide strength to plants). Tissues of Plants : Dermal Tissues {epidermal cells, stomata, trichomes}, Ground tissues {Collenchyma (provide mechanical strength and elasticity to plants), parenchyma (to store food and provide turgidity to organ), sclerenchyma}, and Vascular tissue {Vessel elements, tracheids, companion cells and sieve tubes}. Xylem is a vascular tissue that transports water throughout a plant's body.

question: Roquefortine C is found in : SSC CGL 03/12/2022 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: Cheese. Roquefortine C (C22H23N5O2) - Found in cheese. Although it is a potent neurotoxin at high doses, at low concentrations of 0.05 to 1.47 mg/kg that occur in domestic cheeses, it was found to be "safe for the consumer".

question: Who among the following proposed the term ‘ecosystem’? SSC CGL 06/12/2022 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: A.G. Tansley (1935). The term “ecology” was coined by Ernst Haeckel. Turreson was a Swedish evolutionary botanist who made significant contributions to ecological genetics, and coined the terms ecotype and agamospecies.

question: In ecology, is determined by dividing the biomass per unit area by the age of the ecosystem. SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Biomass productivity. In ecology, the term productivity refers to the rate of generation of biomass in an ecosystem. Units of biomass are grams per metre square (g/m2).

question: In an ecosystem, vertical distribution of different species occupying different levels is called _____. SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Stratification. Different types of the ecosystem : Terrestrial ecosystem - Forest ecosystem, Grassland ecosystem, Desert ecosystem, Tundra ecosystem. Aquatic ecosystem - Freshwater ecosystem, Marine ecosystem. The four main components of an ecosystem are : Productivity, Decomposition, Energy flow and Nutrient cycling. The largest ecosystem in the world is the aquatic ecosystem.

question: The green plants in a terrestrial ecosystem capture about _____ of the energy of sunlight that falls on their leaves and convert it into food energy. SSC MTS 22/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: 1%. The rate of photosynthesis is maximum in Red light and minimum in green light. The only metal present in chlorophyll - Magnesium. The Chlorophyll (C55H72MgN4O5) helps plants to absorb energy from the sun as they undergo the process of photosynthesis.

question: When the bread rises and bakes, ______ creates thousands of bubbles in the dough. SSC MTS 25/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Carbon dioxide. Bread rises because yeast eats sugar and burps carbon dioxide, which gets trapped by the bread’s gluten. The more sugar yeast eats, the more gas that gets formed, and the higher the bread rises.

question: Which level of the food chain includes millipede, springtails, woodlice, dung flies and slugs that feed on the dead or decaying plants or animals? SSC CHSL 24/05/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Detritivores - An organism (such as an earthworm or a fungus) that feeds on dead and decomposing organic matter.

question: A balanced diet takes care of all the following aspects, EXCEPT one. Identify the aspect. SSC CHSL 30/05/2022 (Evening)

options.B: Meets the RDA for all nutrients
options.D: Includes a variety of food items

solution.explanation: Promotes a healthy mind. The 7 components of a balanced diet are Carbohydrates, Proteins, Fats, Vitamins, Minerals, Fibre and Water.

question: What is a way in which adaptation does NOT take place? SSC CHSL 01/06/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Emotional. Adaptations are of three types : Morphological adaptation is a structural change which gives an organism a greater chance of survival in its habitat. Behavioural adaptations are changes in behaviour that certain organisms or species use to survive in a new environment. Physiological adaptation is an internal change that animals and plants go through to ensure their survival in their environment.

question: How do humans acclimatize at high altitudes where atmospheric pressure is low for normal breathing? SSC CHSL 03/06/2022 (Morning)

solution.correct_answer: B. By increasing red blood cell
solution.explanation: During acclimatization (getting used to a new climate) over a few days to weeks, the body produces

question: Which of the following plants is on the verge of extinction due to insensitivity to our environment? SSC CHSL 06/06/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Madhuca insignis (Sapotaceae) is endemic to India. It had been declared extinct due to habitat loss, however, it has been rediscovered in Karnataka.

question: A pyramid of biomass is a diagram that shows the population at each level of the food chain. Accordingly, ________ occupy the base with the highest biomass. SSC CHSL 08/06/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Producers. A biomass pyramid is the representation of total living biomass and shows energy levels at different trophic levels in an ecosystem.

question: Name a common ingredient made from the starchy part of corn kernels used as a thickening agent for gravies, marinades, sauces, soups and casseroles. SSC CHSL 08/06/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Corn starch is the most common thickening agent used in the industry. It is mixed with water or juice and boiled to make fillings and to give a glossy semi-clear finish to products. Potato starch is also used to thicken soups, sauces, and pie fillings. Gelatin is a protein obtained by boiling skin, tendons, ligaments, and/or bones with water. It is usually obtained from cows or pigs. Pectin is a fiber found in fruits.

question: Which Act was enacted in India with the aim of curbing illegal trade in wildlife and derivative parts? SSC CHSL 09/06/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Wildlife Protection Act 1972 provides for the protection of the country's wild animals, birds, and plant species, in order to ensure environmental and ecological security.

question: Why are species of moss used as fuel? SSC CHSL 06/06/2022 (Morning)

options.B: Provide peat that have long been

solution.correct_answer: B. Provide peat that have long been
solution.explanation: Moss, (division Bryophyta) are small nonvascular spore-bearing land plants. They are distributed throughout the world except in salt water. Peat derived from Peat moss can be used as a fuel or as packing material for trans-shipment of leaving material because of their high water holding capacity.

question: The foul smell from a body especially during a sultry summer is due to the action of ______ on sweat. SSC CGL 12/04/2022(Morning)

solution.explanation: Bacteria. Melanin is a substance in your body that produces hair, eye and skin pigmentation. Moisture - water in small drops on a surface, in the air, etc. A virus is a submicroscopic infectious agent that replicates only inside the living cells of an organism.

question: Saccharomyces Cerevisiae is commonly used to make ______. SSC CGL 19/04/2022(Morning)

solution.explanation: Bread. It is known as “brewer's yeast” or “baker's yeast”. Saccharomyces cerevisiae, a type of budding yeast, is able to ferment sugar into carbon dioxide and alcohol and is commonly used in the baking and brewing industries.

question: Which of the following does NOT belong to ‘Kingdom Fungi’ ? SSC CGL 20/04/2022(Morning)

solution.explanation: Euglena is a genus of single cell flagellate eukaryotes. Euglena are unicellular organisms classified into the Kingdom Protista, and the Phylum Euglenophyta. Fungi examples - Rhizopus, Penicillium and Aspergillus, Taphrina and Puccinia, Lichens and mycorrhiza, Mucor, Saccharomyces, Agaricus, Trichoderma.
